Inference APIs ¶

This section shows all the classes and functions used for the inference tasks on the SQuARE platform.

Adapters ¶

class square_model_inference.inference.adaptertransformer. AdapterTransformer ( model_name , batch_size , disable_gpu , transformers_cache , max_input_size , ** kwargs ) [source] ¶

The class for all adapter-based models using the adapter-transformers package

__init__ ( model_name , batch_size , disable_gpu , transformers_cache , max_input_size , ** kwargs ) [source] ¶

Initialize the Adapter with its underlying Transformer and pre-load all available adapters from adapterhub.ml

Parameters

  • model_name – the Huggingface model name

  • batch_size – batch size used for inference

  • disable_gpu – do not move model to GPU even if CUDA is available

  • transformers_cache – Should be same as TRANSFORMERS_CACHE env variable. This folder will be used to store the adapters

  • max_input_size – requests with a larger input are rejected

  • kwargs – Not used

_load_adapter ( model_name , transformers_cache ) [source] ¶

Pre-load all available adapters for MODEL_NAME from adapterhub.ml. We parse the hub index to extract all names and then load each model.

Parameters

  • model_name – the Huggingface model name

  • transformers_cache – Should be same as TRANSFORMERS_CACHE env variable. This folder will be used to store the adapters

async predict ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest , task : square_model_inference.models.request.Task ) → square_model_inference.models.prediction.PredictionOutput [source] ¶

Take an input, pre-process it accordingly, perform inference according to the task, post-process the result and return it

Parameters

  • payload – the prediction request containing the input and any other parameters required

  • task – The task that the model should perform with the payload

Returns

the result of the prediction

Return type

PredictionOutput

HF Transformers ¶

class square_model_inference.inference.transformer. Transformer ( model_name , model_class , batch_size , disable_gpu , max_input_size , ** kwargs ) [source] ¶

The class for all Huggingface transformer-based models

__init__ ( model_name , model_class , batch_size , disable_gpu , max_input_size , ** kwargs ) [source] ¶

Initialize the Transformer

Parameters

  • model_name – the Huggingface model name

  • model_class – the class name (according to CLASS_MAPPING) to use

  • batch_size – batch size used for inference

  • disable_gpu – do not move model to GPU even if CUDA is available

  • max_input_size – requests with a larger input are rejected

  • kwargs – Not used

_ensure_tensor_on_device ( ** inputs ) [source] ¶

Ensure PyTorch tensors are on the specified device.

Parameters

inputs (keyword arguments that should be torch.Tensor ) – The tensors to place on self.device .

Returns

The same as inputs but on the proper device.

Return type

Dict[str, torch.Tensor]

_load_model ( model_cls , model_name , disable_gpu ) [source] ¶

Load the Transformer model model_name and its tokenizer with Huggingface. Model will be moved to GPU unless CUDA is unavailable or disable_gpu is true.

_predict ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest , output_features = False ) → Union [ dict , Tuple [ dict , dict ] ] [source] ¶

Inference on the input.

Parameters

  • request – the request with the input and optional kwargs

  • output_features – return the features of the input. Necessary if, e.g., attention mask is needed for post-processing.

Returns

The model outputs and optionally the input features

_question_answering ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest ) → square_model_inference.models.prediction.PredictionOutput [source] ¶

Span-based question answering for a given question and context. We expect the input to use the (question, context) format for the text pairs.

Parameters

request – the prediction request

async predict ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest , task : square_model_inference.models.request.Task ) → square_model_inference.models.prediction.PredictionOutput [source] ¶

Take an input, pre-process it accordingly, perform inference according to the task, post-process the result and return it

Parameters

  • payload – the prediction request containing the input and any other parameters required

  • task – The task that the model should perform with the payload

Returns

the result of the prediction

Return type

PredictionOutput

Sentence-Transformers ¶

class square_model_inference.inference.sentencetransformer. SentenceTransformer ( model_name , batch_size , disable_gpu , max_input_size , ** kwargs ) [source] ¶

The class for all sentence-transformers models

__init__ ( model_name , batch_size , disable_gpu , max_input_size , ** kwargs ) [source] ¶

Initialize the SentenceTransformer

Parameters

  • model_name – the sentence-transformer model name ( https://sbert.net/docs/pretrained_models.html )

  • batch_size – batch size used for inference

  • disable_gpu – do not move model to GPU even if CUDA is available

  • max_input_size – requests with a larger input are rejected

  • kwargs – Not used

_load_model ( model_name , disable_gpu ) [source] ¶

Load the Transformer model model_name and its tokenizer with Huggingface. Model will be moved to GPU unless CUDA is unavailable or disable_gpu is true.

Parameters

  • model_name – the sentence-transformer model name ( https://sbert.net/docs/pretrained_models.html )

  • disable_gpu – do not move model to GPU even if CUDA is available

async predict ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest , task : square_model_inference.models.request.Task ) → square_model_inference.models.prediction.PredictionOutput [source] ¶
Parameters

  • request – the prediction request

  • task – task for which the prediction is required (e.g. embedding)

ONNX ¶

class square_model_inference.inference.onnx. Onnx ( model_path : str , model_name : str , batch_size : int , disable_gpu : bool , max_input_size : int , decoder_path : Optional [ str ] = None , ** kwargs ) [source] ¶
__init__ ( model_path : str , model_name : str , batch_size : int , disable_gpu : bool , max_input_size : int , decoder_path : Optional [ str ] = None , ** kwargs ) → None [source] ¶
Parameters

  • model_path – patyh where the model is stored

  • model_name – the ONNX model name

  • batch_size – batch size used for inference

  • disable_gpu – do not move model to GPU even if CUDA is available

  • max_input_size – requests with a larger input are rejected

  • decoder_path – path to the decoder ONNX model

  • kwargs – Not used

_beam_search ( request , prompt , max_length ) [source] ¶

Performs beam search for the given prompt

Parameters

  • request – the inference request

  • prompt – the generation prompt

  • max_length – the maximum length of the generated sequence

Returns

the generated sequence(s)

_embedding ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest ) → square_model_inference.models.prediction.PredictionOutput [source] ¶

Embeds the input from the request

Parameters

request – The request containing input and optionally task kwargs like embedding method

Returns

The embedding output

_generation ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest ) → square_model_inference.models.prediction.PredictionOutput [source] ¶

Generates a continuation for the given input sequence

Parameters

request – The request with e.g. the input sequence

Returns

The output containing the generated text

_greedy_generation ( request , prompt , max_length ) [source] ¶

Performs greedy generation for the prompts

Parameters

  • request – the inference request

  • prompt – the prompt for the generation

  • max_length – the maximum length of the generated sequence

Returns

the ids of the generated sequence and the score

_predict ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest , output_features = False , features = None ) → Union [ dict , Tuple [ dict , dict ] ] [source] ¶

Inference on the input.

Parameters

  • request – the request with the input and optional kwargs

  • output_features – return the features of the input. Necessary if, e.g., attention mask is needed for post-processing.

Returns

The model outputs and optionally the input features

_prepare_input ( encoder_features , generated_sequence ) [source] ¶

Prepares the input for the _predict method. If the model is an encoder decoder model the generated sequence is the decoder input.

Parameters

  • encoder_features – the features of the prompt

  • generated_sequence – the generated ids

Returns

the features for the model

_preprocess_logits ( scores , top_k = None , top_p = None , min_tokens_to_keep = 1 , filter_value = - inf ) [source] ¶

Sets the scores for all tokens that are not in top_p and top_k to the filter value (default = -inf). Adapted from huggingface/transformers/generation_logits_process.py

Parameters

  • scores – the initial scores for each token

  • top_k – the top_k threshold

  • top_p – the top_p threshold

  • min_tokens_to_keep – the min_number_of_tokens_to_keep

  • filter_value – the value to replace the scores with

Returns

the processed scores

_sequence_classification ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest ) → square_model_inference.models.prediction.PredictionOutput [source] ¶

Classifies the given input

Parameters

request – The request containing e.g. the input text

Returns

The prediction output containing the predicted labels

_token_classification ( request : square_model_inference.models.request.PredictionRequest ) → square_model_inference.models.prediction.PredictionOutput [source] ¶

Classifies each token of the input text

Parameters

request – The request containing e.g. the input text

Returns

the classification output containing the labels

get_bos_token ( ) [source] ¶

Depending on the model the beginning of sentence token id can be different or not provided.

Returns

beginning of sentence token id

square_model_inference.inference.onnx. calc_banned_ngram_tokens ( prev_input_ids , num_hypos : int , no_repeat_ngram_size : int , cur_len : int ) → None [source] ¶

Copied from fairseq for no_repeat_ngram in beam_search
